title: The Software Collapse Has Already Happened
author: Lida Liberopoulou
core_claim: The software industry's value-producing mechanisms have already collapsed. Not 'they will collapse', they have collapsed. What remains is a transition period where incumbents deploy defensive measures that delay recognition but cannot reverse the structural shift.
abstract: This thesis argues that AI has already collapsed traditional software value capture mechanisms. The evidence: execution layers opening (Openbot 100K+ stars), model layers cracking (DeepSeek V3 MIT), UI commoditizing (MCP Apps), memory opening (mem0), integration standardizing (MCP). Incumbent responses—ads, caps, outcome pricing, context graphs—are defensive measures that cannot reverse the structural shift. The rational response is acceleration: open the layers that have become non-scarce, maintain portable context, avoid capture.

parts.title: The Collapse (Present Tense)
parts.summary: Evidence that implementation layers are already open: Openbot, DeepSeek V3, MCP Apps, mem0, MCP specification.

parts.title: The Paradox
parts.summary: The better AI gets, the more existing value it destroys—but it doesn't create equivalent new monetary value. This strains every AI business model.

parts.title: The Desperation Playbook
parts.summary: Incumbent defensive measures: OpenAI ads, Claude Code caps, outcome-based pricing, platform capture strategies.

parts.title: The Platform Capture Play
parts.summary: Context graphs as infrastructure for capturing user decision traces. Foundation Capital thesis, healthcare ambitions, the 'reasoning as asset' play.

parts.title: Why Defense Fails
parts.summary: Marginal cost collapse makes moats untenable. Open alternatives emerge faster than capture can consolidate.

parts.title: The Transition Period
parts.summary: The intermediate state: hybrid human-AI systems that are more fragile than either extreme. Klarna and Salesforce reversals as evidence.

parts.title: Counter-Trajectory: Evidence That Alternatives Exist
parts.summary: Open infrastructure as counter-positioning. User-controlled memory, portable context, verifiable alignment.

parts.title: Threadbaire as Counter-Infrastructure
parts.summary: Open method for portable AI memory + context. Receipts for decision provenance. RundownAPI for self-describing integration.

parts.title: Why Open Is Safer
parts.summary: Verifiable alignment vs. platform observation. Local agents that cannot phone home are safer than cloud agents with unverifiable terms.

parts.title: The 1989 Analogy
parts.summary: New value systems only become visible after constraints lift. Defending old mechanisms will not produce new value—recombination requires open access.

related_projects.name: Threadbaire Method
related_projects.description: Markdown templates for portable AI memory

related_projects.name: Threadbaire Server
related_projects.description: Database backend when templates outgrow context windows

related_projects.name: RundownAPI
related_projects.description: Open spec for AI self-integration endpoints

provenance.attribution_text: Liberopoulou, L. (2026). The Software Collapse Has Already Happened. https://github.com/threadbaire/thesis
